definition: to think/to believe/to suppose/to wish/to want/to miss (feel wistful about the absence of sb or sth)

sentences.english: Encourage her release by constructing an erotic fantasy before things heat up.
sentences.chinese: 应当在高潮激发前鼓励她通过性幻想放松自己。

sentences.english: The idea of bringing revolution to the countryside had turned out to be a fantasy.
sentences.chinese: 改造农村的革命理想成了虚妄的幻想。

sentences.english: Inspiration-here they naturally grow up and we limitlessly imagine. …
sentences.chinese: 它们在这里自然生长，我们在这里任意幻想。

sentences.english: Mr Rudd has few illusions about China.
sentences.chinese: 陆先生对中国并没有太多幻想。

sentences.english: They continued to view this fantasy of the future as possible.
sentences.chinese: 他们仍然认为未来的这种幻想是可能的。

sentences.english: Xiao fantasy to the exam, want to push the temperature MinGu housekeeping.
sentences.chinese: 晓幻想要考试，想推了温民家的家政。

sentences.english: There are some touching illusions which are, perhaps, sublime realities.
sentences.chinese: 有些动人的幻想也许真是最神圣的现实。

sentences.english: Palomar. This is a witty, elegant, fantastic tale.
sentences.chinese: 这是一个机智，优雅，充满幻想的故事。

sentences.english: Let me fancy while I may.
sentences.chinese: 让我在能幻想的时候尽情幻想吧。

sentences.english: Let me fancy while I may.
sentences.chinese: 让我在能幻想的时候尽情幻想吧。

sentences.english: Other art critics have suggested that Kemp has succumbed to a fantasy.
sentences.chinese: 其他艺术批评家也认为坎普屈从于幻想。

sentences.english: Shattered Type Create the illusion that text is being shattered like glass.
sentences.chinese: 粉碎型创建该文本正在像玻璃破碎的幻想。

sentences.english: He's a full-blooded footballer with fantastic instincts.
sentences.chinese: 他是一名拥有幻想般本能的纯正的足球运动员。

sentences.english: We are so kind of shamanistic that we are dreaming more often than not.
sentences.chinese: 我们在某种程度上都有点萨满，我们常常幻想。

sentences.english: I can not sleep in bed, imagine the sea grouper and barracuda.
sentences.chinese: 我在床上无法入眠，幻想着海中的石斑鱼和梭鱼。

sentences.english: You and your fantasy danced and laughed and never stumbled.
sentences.chinese: 你和你的幻想欢乐地跳舞，从没有被绊倒过。

definition: to long for/to look forward to/longing/vision for the future
an extravagant hope/to have excessive expectations
to yearn for/to look forward to
reverie/daydream/to be lost in wild and fanciful thoughts
